awd_titl_txt: Collaborative Research on Work, Class, and Mobility         in Russia and the United States
awd_abstract_narration: This collaborative research (with Wright, SES92-09210) will                study work, social class, and social mobility in Russia and the                 United States.  Exact replicate surveys were designed and                       administered in European Russia and the USA in 1991.  The study                 will analyze these survey data to describe and compare the class                structure in the two countries.  The study will examine                         differences between the US and Russia in attitudes toward                       egalitarianism, the normative link between education, occupation                and income, and attitudes toward state versus private control of                the economy.                                                                         The study will provide a much need comparative perspective                 on social stratification in Russia and the United States and shed               new light on the relationship between social structure and                      stratification processes.  The study also will make an important                contribution to the study of the relationship between type of                   political economy and social mobility and equality of                           opportunity.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Social, Behavioral and Economic Sciences
org_div_long_name: Division of Social and Economic Sciences
